channel.title: FLF - The Theology Pugcast
channel.description:
The Fight Laugh Feast Network produces Christ-centered content for all of life, for all the world. Featuring CrossPolitic (Christ over Politics) Podcast and Show, which mixes the taboo formula of faith, culture, and politics in order to bring the clarity of the gospel into muddle America. We are a community of Christians who desire to see the Lordship of Christ in every corner of our culture, reigning over every politician, and changing every individual for our good and His glory.
Our shows are made up of pastors, deacons, filmmakers, teachers, professors, and more, and long to see our nation once again recognize Jesus as the redeemer of our fallen nation. Our shows have interviewed notable public figures (including presidential candidates Senator Ted Cruz and Dr. Ben Carson), written books, preach at churches and on college campuses, produced films, and utilize every avenue possible to declare the gospel of our Lord to our broken world.
channel.itunes:subtitle: CrossPolitic Show, Law & Profits, Theology Pugcast, and more...
channel.itunes:author: CrossPolitic Studios

image.title: Fight Laugh Feast Network

item.title: The Theology Pugcast: Stoics, and Epicureans, and Cynics, Oh, My!
item.dc:creator: CrossPolitic Studios
item.description: Who were the philosophers that Paul addressed at Mars Hill in Acts 17? Today the Pugsters examine the outlooks of two schools of philosophy in antiquity–stoicism and epicureanism. And they look at how these schools of thought are making a come back today.
item.itunes:subtitle: Who were the philosophers that Paul addressed at Mars Hill in Acts 17? Today the Pugsters examine the outlooks of two schools of philosophy in antiquity–stoicism and epicureanism. And they look at how these schools of thought are making a come back

item.title: The Theology Pugcast: Shooting Rousseau Twice … and Clubbing Him with the Gun
item.dc:creator: CrossPolitic Studios
item.description: Glenn has been the subject of memes about his attitude toward Rousseau. In this episode, he explains why, focused on three areas: Rousseau as the root of Carl Trueman’s Psychological Man; his attitudes toward education and women; and his political theory, its influence on Marx, and the death toll that came from implementing it. Tom […]

item.title: The Theology Pugcast: Incarnation and Its Significance For Understanding All Things
item.dc:creator: CrossPolitic Studios
item.description: Tom delves into many of the often taken for granted reality implications of the Christian teaching about the Incarnation of God the Son. item.title: The Theology Pugcast: The Prohibitive Cost of a Seminary Education
item.dc:creator: CrossPolitic Studios
item.description: Has inflation made a ministerial education unaffordable? It seems like it. Today a Master of Divinity degree—something that most Reformed denominations require for ordination—can leave the typical ministerial student tens of thousands of dollars in debt. This might be forgivable if pastors were paid like medical doctors, but they’re not. But we need an educated […]

item.title: The Theology Pugcast: The Slavery Show
item.dc:creator: CrossPolitic Studios
item.description: Evidence indicates that slavery was a universal institution. It was practiced on every inhabited continent. It isn’t a particularly western institution at all.
